intro: Wulfenia blechicii subsp. rohlenae, commonly known as the Rohlen's wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological adaptations.
